headers.subject: Re: intellectual property issue
headers.received: from sub.sonic.net (208.201.224.8) by b.smtp-out.sonic.net with SMTP; 26 Sep 2002 05:14:37 -0000
headers.list-id: Developing applications for Mac OS X <macosx-dev.omnigroup.com>

body.para: More recently, it was the BBC in England who claims to have a decades-old patent on hyperlinks, but only ones that one accesses through the keyboard. They were claiming that "evolution of technology" allowed them to extend their patent to the modern hyperlink. Much as I respect the BBC, I hope they don't win their extended court battle.
On Monday, September 23, 2002, at 12:09 PM, macosx-dev-request@omnigroup.com wrote:

quote.quotepara: I think it was AT&T who claimed a while ago to have a patent on hyperlinks. I don't think they won though, because they found some 80 year old programmer who designed something like hyperlinks before the time when AT&T claimed they "invented" it.
Advanced apology to anyone who had patented "A methodology to post a question using an email to a group of people over network" already.
Just send me a license fee of $100 and we'll call it quits! ;)
